meanings.definition: A type of cell that plays a role in the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The cytes in our body help fight off germs and keep us healthy.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how cytes work to protect us from getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The cytes in the body are like tiny superheroes fighting against villains.
meanings.sent4: The cytes act as vigilant guards, constantly patrolling for any intruders.
meanings.sent5: Imagine cytes as tiny soldiers defending our body from invaders.

meanings.definition: A suffix used in biology to indicate a cell or cell component.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use the term cytes to describe different types of cells in the body.
meanings.sent2: When studying biology, you will often come across words ending in -cytes.
meanings.sent3: The biology class had a fun challenge to create new words using the cytes suffix.
meanings.sent4: In the world of biology, -cytes is like a secret code that reveals cell-related information.
meanings.sent5: Learning about -cytes makes understanding cell structures easier and more exciting.
